result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs.
Defendant to complete AODA Assessment and all follow through.
Defendant is to successfully complete Recovery Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

2:57 PM ADA Diaz appears in person for the state. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Kuczynski. Joint recommendation presented to the court. State moves to amend count 1. Court grants amendment of count 1. Amended information filed. Court advised defendant of rights/max penalties. Defendant KVI waives all rights and enters NC pleas to amended count 1 and count 2. Court finds defendant G of amended count 1 and count 2. Defendant sentenced on amended count 1. Count 2, sentence is withheld and defendant is placed on a 24 month Diversion Agreement.
Diversion Agreement (signed by all parties)

Defendant not to possess or consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription. Defendant not to possess drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant, Thomas Labeff. Defendant is to not have contact with any known drug users; defined as anyone with any drug related convictions in the last 5 years except within a bona fide treatment setting. Defendant may have contact with Quentin Eichman.
